medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
title: Sawamura S?j?r? II and ?tani Hiroji III
text: This print depicts a scene from a Kabuki play performed in 1768. The plot is based on a folktale about an old woman who lived in an isolated house. She kindly offers lost travelers a place to rest, but murders them in the night. Sawamura S'jñr' II is shown playing the role of the evil old woman, who grabs the topknot of a warrior, played by 'tani Hiroji III. With his sword unsheathed, the warrior tries to defend himself from her unexpected attack.  S'jñr' II, who was tall and graceful, did not typically play old women. Nonetheless, as described here by Shunsh' with contorted arms and disheveled hair, he played the role to terrifying effect.
